pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

:v: semorrison can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

I'm going to merge, despite not following the last request from the delegator, because this is blocking updating bump/v4.9.0. I'll pick up this thread on zulip.

bors p=10

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9165940325/job/25200364491)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9165940325/job/25200364365)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9165940325/job/25200364626)

Maybe something like:
```suggestion
#adaptation_note /-- (4.9.0) Not immediately obvious how to use `measure_empty` here. -/
set_option linter.deprecated false in
```
Please rephrase!
I disagree with using `#adaptation_note` here. This has nothing to do with v4.9.0: it's always been deprecated, the only new thing is that v4.9.0 will tell us about this.
I think `set_option linter.deprecated false` is exactly the annotation we need to keep track of these defects!

Idem
```suggestion
#adaptation_note  /-- (4.9.0) not immediately obvious how to replace `iUnion` here. -/
set_option linter.deprecated false in
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: backport fixes to deprecations in dot notation
